Influenza virus infection is still a topic of great relevance to global health.
1 The high percentage of hospitalizations (65.1%) and mortality in the age group of over 64 (17.5%), especially those over the age of 80, where mortality is higher (33.3%), reflects the increase in the life expectancy of the population. This fact makes it necessary to deepen in the knowledge of how they affect aging, their interaction with the most prevalent chronic diseases in the elderly and their immune response in order to apply preventive measures that offer a better protection to this population group.
